head.title: A General Store Springs Up in Midtown

hedline.hl1: A General Store Springs Up in Midtown

abstract.p: Decorator's Reserve, furniture and home decorations store that specializes in replicas of Classical, Victorian and Art Deco-style wooden furniture, opens on West 42nd Street; logo (New Yorkers & Co column)

block.p: Walking into Decorator's Reserve, a furniture and home decorations store that opened June 17 at 11 West 42nd Street, is like walking into a small-town general store of 1915; except, that is, for the air-conditioning and the life-size fiberglass statues of celebrities like Marilyn Monroe ($439). The store specializes in replicas of Classical, Victorian and Art Deco-style wooden furniture, like a piece of a Greek ruin ($129) and a 48-by-72-inch mirror with Victorian wood and resin frame ($489). It also has models of old sports figures and old-style toys like a passenger train with a steam engine and coal car ($115).

The store specializes in replicas of Classical, Victorian and Art Deco-style wooden furniture, like a piece of a Greek ruin ($129) and a 48-by-72-inch mirror with Victorian wood and resin frame ($489). It also has models of old sports figures and old-style toys like a passenger train with a steam engine and coal car ($115).
